activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryan J Mueller

records.addlTxt:
11:23 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan J Mueller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Bryan J Mueller. 

11:27  Court relates and gives appearances.
11:27  Deputy Jo Fick called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
11:30  Cross by Atty. Harrington.
11:31  State moves for bind-over.
11:31  Court finds probable cause and binds over. 
Arraignment set; defendant to appear in person.


(MS scanned to jail)
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Atty Andrew Harrington to be repaid at the rate of $50.00/month to begin on 6/18/2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bryan J Mueller appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steuer appeared by video for Bryan J Mueller for today only.  Attorney Steuer relates Defendant has not called to qualify.  Court relates Defendant advised before he was going to hire his own attorney.  Defendant relates he called public defender last week and did not qualify.  Jail will have Defendant fill out blue form.  Case to be recalled.  **10:23 a.m. Defendant completed blue form and was sworn.  Jail to bring blue form up.  **10:27 a.m. case recalled again.  Blue form presented.  Court appoints Attorney Andrew Harrington to be repaid at $50.00 per month starting 06/18/2022.  10:29 a.m. Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington appeared by video for Bryan J Mueller. Preliminary hearing requested and put in a breakout room at 10:30 a.m. to discuss waiver of time limits.  10:38 a.m. back on the record.  Time limits waived. Preliminary hearing set and may appear by Zoom.

SCANNED TO BARRON COUNTY JAIL
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dustin Rockow appeared by zoom video.   Defendant Bryan J Mueller appeared by video, in custody. 

Defendant must contact the public defenders office to find out if qualifies.  Defendant would like to hire his own attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
